answers.answer: Hi!Yes, people with hypothyroidism find it difficult to lose weight. First check if the thyroid problem is under control. Then, check if you have polycystic ovary, anemia and diabetes as these conditions make it difficult to lose weight. The since people with hypothyroidism burn fat slowly, you need to incorporate more of exercise to lose weight. Also, the diet should have slightly lower calories than required for basal metabolic rate.  Please consult your doctor, a physical trainer and a dietician regarding this.Your doctor may prescribe something to initiate weight loss while you make the diet and exercise adjustment. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.
